content: Additionally, this production growth, even as we generated over $100 million in proceeds from non-core asset sales during 2022, including the sale of our Eagle Ford asset, which was producing roughly 250 barrels of oil per day or just over 1% of our current volumes. I think that kind of mimics how we're thinking about things where on a time period like today, or over the last couple of weeks we've got to sell off, and that's when the buyback kicks in. And I think generally being able to sell that losing 250 to 300 barrels of oil a day, and still hit numbers in 2023 that we expected prior, just shows that we didn't need that asset in the portfolio and instead we're being we're moving to 100% Permian and higher growth.
